page.title: 12NANTGLYN SCHOOLCHILDREN
page.content: The pupils in the junior class liked their school and enjoyed the {lifestyle}of the area because of its quietness.The only complaint was the lack of a village shop. Almost half lived on farms and 3 pupils came to school by taxi.Sometimes winter snow cut them off but most pupils lived less than a mile away so they walked or came by car.{Pets}were owned by 3/4 of the children;all the farms had dogs and most had cats;there was a budgie and a rabbit.Reading was the most {popular hobby,}soap operas especially Dynasty,were preferred to childrens TV Pop groups appealing to teenagers such as Duran Duran were popular with a few{10 year olds.}Others still liked horse riding,piano playing, walking, helping on the farm or just 'playing games'.The average number of children per family was 2.8,the national is 2.1
